saying_wabisabi: Finding beauty in imperfection, impermanence, and incompleteness.
saying_mono_no_aware: The bittersweet awareness of impermanence — a gentle sadness at the passing of things.
saying_komorebi: The interplay of sunlight and leaves as light filters through the trees.
saying_ichigo_ichie: "One time, one meeting." Treasure every encounter, for it will never come again.
saying_ma: The deliberate pause — the meaningful negative space between objects, sounds, or moments.
saying_shinrin_yoku: Forest bathing. The restorative practice of immersing oneself in the atmosphere of the woods.
saying_nana_korobi: "Fall seven times, rise eight." Resilience is not about never falling — it's about always getting back up.
saying_yohaku: Empty space left with intention. The art of knowing what to leave out.
saying_kacho_fugetsu: "Flowers, birds, wind, moon." The meditative appreciation of the natural world.
saying_en: The invisible thread of fate that connects people, places, and moments across time.
saying_tsundoku: Buying books and letting them pile up, unread — the comfort of their mere presence.
saying_shogyo_mujo: All things are in constant flux. Nothing lasts, and that is exactly what makes things beautiful.
